titles.title: Enemy Expatriation Act
A bill to add engaging in or supporting hostilities against the United States to the list of acts for which United States nationals would lose their nationality.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 10/12/2011--Introduced. Enemy Expatriation Act - Amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to include engaging in or purposefully and materially supporting hostilities against the United States to the list of acts for which U.S. nationals would lose their nationality. Defines "hostilities" as any conflict subject to the laws of war.
